intro: Allosorus asper, commonly known as the rough allosorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often aromatic and can be used in traditional herbal remedies. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
